}}'''Ioreth''' was a woman of [[Gondor]] during the [[War of the Ring]].
==History==
Ioreth was originally from [[Imloth Melui]] in [[Lossarnach]], but moved to [[Minas Tirith]] and worked in the [[Houses of Healing]]. By {{TA
column2: 3019}} she was the oldest woman working there and was well versed in old lore, which helped restore the health of [[Faramir]].  She was very talkative, which annoyed [[Aragorn]] and [[Gandalf]].<ref>{{RK

column1: ==Etymology==

''Ioreth'' means "old woman" in [[Sindarin]]; ''[[iaur]]'' "old" plus feminine ending ''[[-eth]]''. In draft, Tolkien had spelt her name ''Yoreth''.<ref name=Joukes>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], "[[Letter to Mr Joukes
column2: Letter to a Mr. Joukes dated August 28, 1967]]", published in [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'', p. 579</ref>

column1: Like "[[Gamling]]", it was specifically chosen to suit the character of the old nurse.<ref name=Joukes/>
